LuminaireType.description: The LuminaireType consists of a set of attributes that together characterize a type of luminaire, i.e.: are generic for, a given luminaire, excluding the concept of Controller, Driver and Bracket.

address.description: TALQ address of the Luminaire Type

gtin.description: Global Trade Item Number of luminaire

maximumLuminousFluxOutput.description: Maximum Light Output luminous flux output (lm)

minimumLuminousFluxOutput.description: Minimum Light Output of the luminaire (lm)

lightDistributionType.description: Enumeration of possible light distribution type, using the Zhaga D4i enumeration. Please refer to ZD4i standard for more details.

lcsRating.description: Defines the distribution of light within in three primary solid angles. ( LCS: Luminaire Classification System for outdoor luminaires for TM 15 - 11 standard.). E.g: F6-33-19-1, B6-26-10-1, U0-0.

lightPhotometry.description: Reference to the photometry of the manufacturer. IES LDT file (e.g. DN08)

driverReplaceable.description: Informs if the driver is replaceable with values: On site, Workshop, No replaceable

lightSourceReplaceable.description: Informs if the light source is replaceable with values: On site, Workshop and No replaceable

corrosionClass.description: Extra protection layer against corrosition environment. To use standard ISO 9223 C1 to C5 (https://www.iso.org/standard/53499.html)

maximumPower.description: Maximum power that the Luminaire can operate at (W)

powerConsumption.description: Expected Power consumption of the luminaire (W)

powerAtMinimumDimLevel.description: Power at minimum dim level for the luminaire. (W)

aerodinamicResistance.description: Equivalent surface area of the luminaire that is exposed to the wind at 0 degrees inclination. (m2). [DEPRECATED: This attribute has been deprecated and it will be removed in the next MAJOR release. Please use the new aerodynamicResistance instead.]

aerodynamicResistance.description: Equivalent surface area of the luminaire that is exposed to the wind at 0 degrees inclination. (m2)

materialEnclosure.description: Material of enclousure of the body of the luminaire

materialLlightCover.description: Material of light cover. [DEPRECATED: This attribute has been deprecated and it will be removed in the next MAJOR release. Please use the new materialLightCover instead.]

position.description: Position of the socket regarding the luminaire

socketTypes.description: List of socket pairs types/receptacles and positions of the luminaire. E.g: [NEMA at top, Zhaga at underside and Other at remote]

controlVoltMax.description: DC voltage that gives the maximum light output in a 1-10V control type.

controlVoltMin.description: DC voltage that gives the minimum light output in a 1-10V control type.

minLightOutput.description: Sets the minimum light output under which the lamp actuator will not perform the command.

virtualLightOutput.description: Sets the light output that the lamp actuator shall consider to be equal to 100%. This scaling factor shall be applied before applying the required control voltage. The light command output shall be scaled using this factors, so that 100% in the light command corresponds to this value before applying CLO and maintenance factors.

daliLedLinear.description: If set to True indicates the dimming curve is linear for DALI control type (some lamp control gear only use linear).

warmUpTime.description: Sets the delay after a Switch ON command during which the lamp actuator shall not perform any dimming command.

coolDownTime.description: Sets the delay after a Switch OFF command during which the lamp actuator shall not perform any Switch ON command.(seconds)

lowCurrentThreshold.description: Level of the luminaire supply current under which the ODN shall detect a currentTooLow event.

highCurrentThreshold.description: Level of the luminaire supply current above which the ODN shall detect a currentTooHigh event.

highTemperatureThreshold.description: Temperature above which the temperatureTooHigh event is triggered

maxOperatingHours.description: Maximum number of operating hours that the lamp is supposed to live with a given specification. This attribute can be used to set the old lamp attributes when the lamp reaches its expected useful life.

powerLightGradient.description: The ratio of change of light level divided by change in power level, which is the slope of the Light level vs. Power curve. It is assumed that 100% power refers to 100% light output. If this attribute is not specified, the attribute shall be set to 1 as default.

lampPowerTolerance.description: The number of watts by which the actual lamp power can be in error from the expected lamp power (as defined by the dimming curve and the current dimming level) before a lamp power event (lampPowerTooHigh or lampPowerTooLow) is triggered.

lampPowerHighThreshold.description: The absolute number of watts above which the absoluteLampPowerTooHigh event is triggered

lampPowerLowThreshold.description: The absolute number of watts below which the absolutLampPowerTooLow event is triggered

powerFactorThreshold.description: The threshold below which powerFactorTooLow event is triggered

operatingHours.description: Specific number of operating hours to which the percentage refers.

percentage.description: The lamp power, in percentage, at a specific time in the future, to keep the lumen output constant.

lumenDepreciationCurve.description: Ordered set of entries (cumulative operating hours, correction factor in %) that form a piece wise linear approximation of the lumen depreciation correction factor curve. The first cumulative hours should be 0 and the last correction factor should be 100%. E.g.: 0 h, 80%; 5000 h, 85%; 10000 h, 90%; 15000 h, 95%; 20000 h, 100%.

cloType.description: Determines where CLO (Constant Lumen Output) is implemented in the lamp control gear or in the ODN (e.g. control device). This CLO profile is needed even when CLO is implemented by the driver in order to obtain the expected lamp power.

powerFactor.description: Specific power factor threshold to which the dim level percentage refers. The power factor can get values in the range from 0 to 1.

powerFactorThresholdDimmingCurve.description: Ordered set of entries (power factor threshold, dim level in %) that form a linear approximation of the power factor threshold vs dimming curve. The first dimming should be 0% and the last 100%. E.g.: 0.65 , 0%; 0.60, 10%; 0.70, 20%; 0.75, 30%; 0.80, 40%; 0.85, 50%; 0.87, 60%; 0.89, 70%; 0.90, 80%; 0.95, 90%; 0.98, 100%.

lightSourceGtin.description: Global Trade Item Number of light source

minimumOperatingTemperature.description: Minimum environment temperature in which the luminaire can operate (Degree Celsius)

maximumOperatingTemperature.description: Maximum environment temperature in which the luminaire can operate (Degree)

BracketType.description: The BracketType consists of a set of attributes that together characterize, i.e: are generic for, a given Bracket.

address.description: TALQ address of the Bracket Type

name.description: Descriptive name of the Bracket Type

gtin.description: Global Trade Item Number of bracket

mountingOptions.description: Different options to mount the luminaire to the support

mountMinDiameter.description: Mount minimum diameter of the bracket (mm)

mountMaxDiameter.description: Mount maximum diameter of the bracket (mm)

tiltMinimum.description: Minimum horizontal inclination of the bracket (positive and negative value). 0 degree means that it is parallel to the LED board (deg)

tiltMaximum.description: Maximum horizontal inclination of the bracket (only positive value). 0 degree means that it is parallel to the LED board (deg)

aerodinamicResistance.description: Equivalent surface area of the bracket that is exposed to the wind. (m2). [DEPRECATED: This attribute has been deprecated and it will be removed in the next MAJOR release. Please use the new aerodynamicResistance instead.]

aerodynamicResistance.description: Equivalent surface area of the bracket that is exposed to the wind. (m2)

DriverType.description: The DriverType consists of a set of attributes that together characterize, i.e. are generic for, a given Driver.

address.description: TALQ address of the Driver Type

name.description: Descriptive name of the Driver Type

controlElectricalInterfaceTypes.description: The control electrical interface type of the connector of the driver

controlInterfaceProtocolTypes.description: The control interface protocol type of the connector of the driver.

nominalAcMainsVoltage.description: Nominal AC mains voltage for the luminaire to operate. (V)

maxAcMainsVoltage.description: Max AC mains voltage for the luminaire to operate. (V)

minAcMainsVoltage.description: Nominal Min AC mains voltage for the luminaire to operate. (V)

nominalDcMainsVoltage.description: Nominal DC mains voltage for the luminaire to operate. (V)

maxDcMainsVoltage.description: Max DC mains voltage for the luminaire to operate. (V)

minDcMainsVoltage.description: Nominal Min DC mains voltage for the luminaire to operate. (V)

gtin.description: Global Trade Item Number of driver

controlOutputType.description: Constant voltage or constant current regulated

driverNominalCurrent.description: The pre-programmed current in the driver, determined also by the LED board (A)

driverNominalVoltage.description: The pre-programmed voltage in the driver, determined also by the LED board (V)

ratedLifeTime.description: Rated life time of the driver at the maximum operating temperature of the luminaire. (Hours)

ControllerType.description: The ControllerType consists of a set of attributes that together characterize, i.e. are generic for, a given Controller.

address.description: TALQ address of the Controller Type

name.description: Descriptive name of the Controller Type

gtin.description: Global Trade Item Number of the controller

powerConsumption.description: Expected Power consumption of the controller (W)

productFamily.description: Product family name of the controller

mechanicalInterfaces.description: Type of mechanical connection or socket

electricalInterfaces.description: The control interface protocol type of the connector of the driver.

protocols.description: Type of digital communication of the controller

LampType.description: The lamp type consists of a set of attributes that together characterize a given lamp and control gear combination. When modelling a Lighting ODN with many luminaires, there are attributes' values that are the same for many lamps, e.g.: the expected consumed power of the lamp and control gear (wattage) would be the same for many lamp monitors. The concept of LampType is created to avoid including the same attributes' values in every lamp monitor and actuator of the same type, for this reason a reference to a lamp type is included in the lamp actuator and lamp monitor functions, as these attributes are required for proper operation of these functions. Thus, the definition of lamp types enables the CMS to efficiently set attributes in many lamp actuators/monitors by just setting the address of the “lampType” attribute in each function. Lamp types can be created by both CMS and TALQ Gateway as separate entities. The TALQ Gateway shall announce any lamp type it has to the CMS as part of the initial configuration. In addition to the initial configuration, the TALQ Gateway shall also announce the lamp type whenever it changes. The CMS may also send lamp types to the TALQ Gateway. [DEPRECATED: : This type has been deprecated and it will be removed in the next MAJOR release. Please use the new LuminaireType, BracketType, DriverType and ControllerType instead.]

address.description: TALQ Address of the lamp type.

name.description: Descriptive name of the lamp type.

controlType.description: Describes the type of control/dimming interface between the lamp actuator function and the control gear or within the control gear in case lamp actuator is embedded in the control gear.

wattage.description: Expected consumed power of the lamp and control gear.

controlVoltMax.description: DC voltage that gives the maximum light output in a 1-10V control type.

controlVoltMin.description: DC voltage that gives the minimum light output in a 1-10V control type.

minLightOutput.description: Sets the minimum light output under which the lamp actuator will not perform the command.

virtualLightOutput.description: Sets the light output that the lamp actuator shall consider to be equal to 100%. This scaling factor shall be applied before applying the required control voltage. The light command output shall be scaled using this factors, so that 100% in the light command corresponds to this value before applying CLO and maintenance factors.

daliLedLinear.description: If set to True indicates the dimming curve is linear for DALI control type (some lamp control gear only use linear).

warmUpTime.description: Sets the delay after a Switch ON command during which the lamp actuator shall not perform any dimming command.

coolDownTime.description: Sets the delay after a Switch OFF command during which the lamp actuator shall not perform any Switch ON command.

lowCurrentThreshold.description: Level of the luminaire supply current under which the ODN shall detect a currentTooLow event.

highCurrentThreshold.description: Level of the luminaire supply current above which the ODN shall detect a currentTooHigh event.

lowLampVoltageThreshold.description: Level of lamp voltage (not supply voltage) under which the ODN shall detect a voltageTooLow event. [WARNING: Don't use this attribute as a low supply voltage threshold, use the new LampMonitor.lowSupplyVoltageThreshold introduced by TALQ 2.3.0.]

highLampVoltageThreshold.description: Level of lamp voltage (not supply voltage) above which the ODN shall detect a voltageTooHigh event. [WARNING: Don't use this attribute as a high supply voltage threshold, use the new LampMonitor.highSupplyVoltageThreshold introduced by TALQ 2.3.0.]

highTemperatureThreshold.description: Temperature above which the highTemperature event is triggered.

maxOperatingHours.description: Maximum number of operating hours that the lamp is supposed to live with a given specification. This attribute can be used to set the old lamp attributes when the lamp reaches its expected useful life.

powerLightGradient.description: The ratio of change of light level divided by change in power level, which is the slope of the Light level vs. Power curve. It is assumed that 100% power refers to 100% light output. If this attribute is not specified, the attribute shall be set to 1 as default.

lampPowerTolerance.description: The number of watts by which the actual lamp power can be in error from the expected lamp power (as defined by the dimming curve and the current dimming level) before a lamp power event (lampPowerTooHigh or lampPowerTooLow) is triggered.

lampPowerHighThreshold.description: The absolute number of watts above which the absoluteLampPowerTooHigh event is triggered.

lampPowerLowThreshold.description: The absolute number of watts below which the absoluteLampPowerTooLow event is triggered.

powerFactorThreshold.description: The threshold below which powerFactorTooLow event is triggered.

lumenDepreciationCurve.description: Ordered set of entries (cumulative operating hours, correction factor in %) that form a piece wise linear approximation of the lumen depreciation correction factor curve. The first cumulative hours should be 0 and the last correction factor should be 100%. E.g.: 0 h, 80%; 5000 h, 85%; 10000 h, 90%; 15000 h, 95%; 20000 h, 100%.

operatingHours.description: Specific number of operating hours to which the percentage refers.

percentage.description: The lamp power, in percentage, at a specific time in the future, to keep the lumen output constant.

cloType.description: Determines where CLO (Constant Lumen Output) is implemented in the lamp control gear or in the ODN (e.g. control device). This CLO profile is needed even when CLO is implemented by the driver in order to obtain the expected lamp power.

powerFactorThresholdDimmingCurve.description: Ordered set of entries (power factor threshold, dim level in %) that form a linear approximation of the power factor threshold vs dimming curve. The first dimming should be 0% and the last 100%. E.g.: 0.65 , 0%; 0.60, 10%; 0.70, 20%; 0.75, 30%; 0.80, 40%; 0.85, 50%; 0.87, 60%; 0.89, 70%; 0.90, 80%; 0.95, 90%; 0.98, 100%.

powerFactor.description: Specific power factor threshold to which the dim level percentage refers. The power factor can get values in the range from 0 to 1.

gMonthDay.description: Recurring period of time with yearly day. The string format is '--mm-dd'

gDay.description: Recurring period of time with monthly day. The string format is '---dd'

allOf.description: Each item defines a day within each month (---dd) or day within a specific month (--mm-dd). An item can also define a range by specifying an end in the same format as the start of the item.
List of days of the week. Each item defines a weekday using numbers 1 to 7 where 1 is Monday. An item can also define a range by specifying an end weekday as well.

occurrences.description: The 'occurrences' property allows to execute a control program every Xth Monday or Tuesday or Wednesday or ... of the month, where X is from 1 to 5. The special character 'L' specifies the last Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, ... of the month. The days' 'start' property indicates which day is considered: 1=Monday, 2=Tuesday, 3=Wednesday, ... . As an example, the rule for 'the second Monday of the month' would be achieved with this configuration: days=[{start=1}], occurrences=['2']

CalendarRule.description: A rule is composed of a day-based or a date-based condition and an action. The start of startDate and the end of endDate are assumed to be offset in the way that dayOffset is configured. Thus, given startDate=Day1 and endDate=Day2, when dayOffset=12 (noon-to-noon) the calendar rule becomes active at at 12:00 (noon) of Day1 and ends at noon of Day2+1.

startDate.description: Start date when the rule becomes active. If not specified, the start date is since the beginning of time.

anyOf.description: The string date format is 'yyyy-mm-dd' as defined by OAS3 (full-date - RFC3339)

endDate.description: Last date on which the rule is active. If not specified, the rule shall apply always after the startDate.

anyOf.description: The string date format is 'yyyy-mm-dd' as defined by OAS3 (full-date - RFC3339)

condition.description: The condition can be date or day based. If there is no condition, the rule applies unconditionally.

program.description: The identifier of the control program that the ODN shall apply if the condition is met and has the highest priority.

Calendar.description: A calendar is a set of rules that describe which days and which control program should be applied to which target functions by the ODN. The Rules priorities (eg between the first Thursday of the month and the 3rd of June if the 3rd of June is the first Thursday of the month) is defined by the order in the list.

ownerCMS.description: The address of the owner CMS

defaultProgram.description: Identifier of control program which acts as default if no rule matches

SensorReference.description: TALQ Address of the function representing the sensor to be used as reference. If no reference is provided, the ODN is responsible for deciding which sensor to use. Up to two sensor addresses may be included in the reference, and this case, it is up to the ODN to decide how to use the addresses.

sensorAddresses.description: Up to two sensor addresses may be included in the reference, and this case, it is up to the ODN to decide how to use the addresses.

ControlProgram.description: A control program is a generic mechanism, or template, to automate the control of a system within a day

type.description: Type of Control Program, used for serializing purposes

ownerCMS.description: The address of the owner CMS

allOf.description: A lighting control program is a combination of control actions and trigger conditions that define the lighting control behavior across ODNs in a descriptive way.

activePeriods.description: The list of active periods. An active period defines the period of time during a day when the control program is active. If no active period is defined within a control program, the program is active during the whole day. The AbsoluteActivePeriod is mandatory for CMS and GW. The other AstroClockActivePeriod, SensorActivePeriod and AstroAndSensorActivePeriod are mandatory for CMS, at least one of them shall be supported by the GW.

fixedTimeControls.description: The list of fixed time controls.

astroClockTimeControls.description: The list of astroclock time controls.

FixedTimeControl.description: The Fixed Time Control element defines the control schedule during the day. This control is mandatory for CMS and GW.

startTime.description: Start time (local time including DST) of the fixed time control element. The period will end at the beginning of the next fixed time control element in the program. The next fixed time control element is with respect to the time order of the elements. The order of fixed time control entries within a program shall be in increasing order always to allow the next element to be identified easily. It is not allowed to have two entries with exactly the same start time. In case no start time is available, the implementation should use the last value based on the program executed on the previous day. If such value is also not available, the last value according to the control program description should be used (assuming programs wraparound from day to day). The value must follow the hh:mm:ss format.

DynamicControl.description: The Dynamic Control elements define additional control on top of the control already defined by the Fixed Time Control. This includes the period when the dynamic control is to be applied, and the effect to be applied. If multiple elements are specified, the order of active elements in the JSON sequence determines the priority where the first element has the highest priority and the last one has the lowest priority. This control is optional for CMS and GW.

period.description: Defines the time period during a day when the dynamic control is to be applied. Given an example period, sent by the CMS, of 23:00 to 4:00 assigned to Day1: If dayOffset=0 (midnight to midnight) the period is split into two absolute time intervals, in the Gateway, one starting at 0:00 to 4:00 and other from 23:00 to 0:00, both on Day1. If dayOffset=12 (noon to noon) the period starts at 23:00 on Day1 and ends at 4:00 on the next day.

startTime.description: Local Time (including DST) when the dynamic control element becomes active. The value must follow the hh:mm:ss format.

endTime.description: Local Time (including DST) when the dynamic control element becomes inactive. The value must follow the hh:mm:ss format.

AstroClockTimeControl.description: The AstroClock Time Control element defines the control based on a sunrise/sunset offset. The operation is applied over the existing fixedTimeControls, so with each offset for sunrise or sunset, an operation will be applied over the existing state coming from the fixedTimeControls.

offset.description: Offset in minutes to apply to the calculated time (sunrise or sunset). Both positive and negative values are allowed for this attribute. The period will end at the beginning of the next AstroClock time control element in the program.

solarEventType.description: Type of solar event to which the offset is applied: sunrise or sunset

operation.description: The operation to be executed on the new command and the current state coming from the correspondent fixedTimeControl.

command.description: Command to be used by the operation.

SensorControlSource.description: Source of commands. If the source is within the ODN, it is the responsibility of the ODN to 'connect' the source to the program. If the source is outside the ODN, it is the responsibility of the CMS to also forward the control commands to the ODN running this program.

EffectOperation.description: Operation to be executed on the new command and the current state to determine the action to be applied. These are the descriptions of each operation: Set: Override the current state.; Max: Maximum between the new state (defined by the dynamic control element) and the current state defined by the program. This operation shall have the effect of increasing the current state.; Min: Minimum between the new state (defined by the dynamic control element) and the current state defined by the program. This operation shall have the effect of decreasing the current state.; Add: Adds the new state (defined by the dynamic control element) to the current state defined by the program.; Sub: Subtracts the new state (defined by the dynamic control element) from the current state defined by the program.; Mul: Multiplies the new state (defined by the dynamic control element) by the current state defined by the program. The Set operation is mandatory for CMS and GW, all other operations are optional for CMS and GW.

ControlEffect.description: Abstract element for specifying control effects. This control effect is optional for CMS and GW.

holdTime.description: how long (in seconds) the value will be held after the sensor event is lowered.

allOf.description: Control effect that receives the command from an external source and applies this command using an operation defined by the program.
Control effect uses the active/inactive of a source (sensor) to apply the predefined command with the specified operation.

An absolute active period defines the absolute time period during a day. Given an example absolute active period, sent by the CMS, of 20:00 to 6:00 assigned to Day1: If dayOffset=0 (midnight to midnight) the active period is split into two absolute time intervals, in the Gateway, one starting at 0:00 to 6:00 and other from 20:00 to 0:00, both on Day1. If dayOffset=12 (noon to noon) the absolute active period starts at 20:00 on Day1 and ends at 6:00 on the next day.

startTime.description: Time when the control program, or recording mode, becomes active. The value must follow the hh:mm:ss format.

endTime.description: Time when the control program, or recording mode, becomes inactive. The value must follow the hh:mm:ss format.

allOf.description: The AstroClock active period shall be between the calculated sunset value with the sunsetOffset applied and the calculated sunrise value also with the sunriseOffset offset applied. Example: A sunsetOffset = 10 means 10 minutes after sunset time, while a sunsetOffset = -5 means 5 minutes before sunset time.

sunsetOffset.description: Offset in minutes to apply to the calculated sunset time. Both positive and negative values are allowed for this attribute.

sunriseOffset.description: Offset in minutes to apply to the calculated sunrise time. Both positive and negative values are allowed for this attribute.

allOf.description: The Sensor active period shall be between the instant when the sensor level is less than onLevel value and the instant when the sensor level is larger than the offLevel value.

sensor.description: A reference to a sensor function output.

onLevel.description: The active period starts when the reported level of the sensor function becomes less than the onLevel. For example, if dealing with a lampActuator, this means there is not enough ambient light and artificial lighting may be needed. When a Photocell is used as a sensor, as this function has no level output but binary, onLevel=1 is used as analogous to ON state.

offLevel.description: The active period ends when the reported level of the sensor function becomes larger than the offLevel. For example, if dealing with a lampActuator, this means there is enough ambient light and artificial light may not be needed. When a Photocell is used as a sensor, as this function has no level output but binary, offLevel=0 is used as analogous to OFF state.

allOf.description: The AstroAndSensor active period shall be between the instant when the sensor level is less than onLevel value and the instant when the sensor level is larger than the offLevel value, always between the calculated sunset value with the sunsetOffset applied and the calculated sunrise value also with the sunriseOffset offset applied.

sensor.description: Reference to a function implementing the sensor to be used as input. As an example, it may be a Photocell or Light sensor function or a Generic sensor.

sunsetOffset.description: Offset in minutes to apply to the calculated sunset time. Both positive and negative values are allowed for this attribute.

sunriseOffset.description: Offset in minutes to apply to the calculated sunrise time. Both positive and negative values are allowed for this attribute.

pcActiveBeforeSunset.description: The period in minutes before the sunset moment where the referenced photocell is taken into account and can make the program active.

pcActiveBeforeSunrise.description: The period in minutes before the sunrise moment where the referenced photocell is taken into account and can make the program active.

onLevel.description: The active period starts when the reported level of the sensor function becomes less than the onLevel. For example, if dealing with a lampActuator, this means there is not enough ambient light and artificial lighting may be needed. When a Photocell is used as a sensor, as this function has no level output but binary, onLevel=1 is used as analogous to ON state.

offLevel.description: The active period ends when the reported level of the sensor function becomes larger than the offLevel. For example, if dealing with a lampActuator, this means there is enough ambient light and artificial light may not be needed. When a Photocell is used as a sensor, as this function has no level output but binary, offLevel=0 is used as analogous to OFF state.

allOf.description: The Value active period shall be between the instant when the operation between the attribute (reference) value and the given state (state) is true and the instant when it is false, e.g.: reference: /4EB333B9-53C7-4CDC-BF9A-36FA7C6D53E6/fLampActuator/actualState - operator: GT - state: 20%.

operator.description: The operator to apply between the attribute's value and the state, with this order: {reference} {operator} {state}: Possible values are: EQ = (Equal); NE != Not Equal to);  GE >= Greater than or equal to); GT > Greater than); LE <= Less than or equal to); LT < Less than)

state.description: The operation is calculated between the state and the reference's value.

Group.description: A group is set of entities that can be addressed by the same group address. Devices and functions within devices can be assigned to a group. A group may also include other groups as members.

ownerCMS.description: The address of the owner CMS

members.description: References of members: device(s) or group(s).

purpose.description: Indicates the main purpose this group is used for. [DEPRECATED the enum values 'lampType' and 'attributes' are a v1 inheritance, as they are not usable will be removed at next MAJOR version].

LoggerConfig.description: A LoggerConfig describes a configuration model for the recording of data from the ODN and reporting of this recorded data to the CMS. A data logger may apply to a set of logical devices which is specified by the sourceAddresses whitelist or blacklist attributes. This attribute allows for both white listing and black listing of logical devices. The set of applicable devices shall be defined by the white list reduced by the set defined by the black list. If there is only a black list defined, even if empty, the data logger shall apply to all devices except listed in the black list. If there is no white list, nor a black list, the data logger shall not apply to any logical device. For a better understanding, these are the possible combinations and their consequence: sourceAddress={wl:[], bl:[]} => No devices to log (white empty list of devices, reduced by empty blackList of devices, so no devices); sourceAddress={bl:[]} => All devices to log (as per spec: If there is only a black list defined, even if empty, the data logger shall apply to all devices except listed in the black list.); sourceAddress={wl:[]} => No devices to log (white empty list of devices, so no devices); sourceAddress={} = No devices to log (as per spec: If there is no white list, nor a black list, the data logger shall not apply to any logical device.).

ownerCMS.description: The address of the owner CMS

sourceAddresses.description: This attribute specifies the set of applicable devices defined by the white list reduced by the set defined by the black list. If there is only a black list defined, even if empty, the data logger shall apply to all devices except listed in the black list. If there is no white list, nor a black list, the data logger shall not apply to any logical device. For a better understanding, these are the possible combinations and their consequence: sourceAddress={wl:[], bl:[]} => No devices to log (white empty list of devices, reduced by empty blackList of devices, so no devices); sourceAddress={bl:[]} => All devices to log (as per spec: If there is only a black list defined, even if empty, the data logger shall apply to all devices except listed in the black list.); sourceAddress={wl:[]} => No devices to log (white empty list of devices, so no devices); sourceAddress={} = No devices to log (as per spec: If there is no white list, nor a black list, the data logger shall not apply to any logical device.).

whiteList.description: References of device(s) or group(s) that the logger shall apply to.

blackList.description: References of device(s) or group(s) that the logger shall NOT apply to.

recordingMode.description: Three recording modes are defined: vendor, periodic and event based. Vendor and event recording modes shall be supported by CMS and Gateway.

reportingMode.description: Two reporting modes are defined: scheduled and immediate. Immediate reporting mode shall be supported by CMS and Gateway.

activePeriods.description: The list of active periods. An active period defines the period of time during a day when the recording mode is active. If no active period is defined within a recording mode, the recording is active during the whole day.

allOf.description: In this mode attributes are logged using a recording sampling strategy defined by the Gateway vendor. If no content is defined, the Gateway will record any function/attribute without the CMS specifying it. If the content attribute is an empty array, there are no addresses included thus no data will be recorded.

content.description: Functions to log. If a logical device logged does not support one of the listed functions, the data is just not logged. Only the specified supported functions are logged. This allows a single data log to be used for devices with a different set of functions.

attributeScope.description: If set, only those attributes specified by function (functionId, functionType and attributes) that matches the specified scope will be logged. (i.e: attributeScope='measurement' and function.functionType='LampActuatorFunction' means all the measurement attributes of all the Lamp Actuator functions of the logged devices will be recorded). If it is not set, all attributes specified by the function attributes will be logged.

function.description: Either a functionId or functionType shall be included. If a functionType is used, the description shall apply to all functions of that type

attributes.description: One or more attributes of the function to log.

name.description: Name of the attribute to be logged.

onChangeThreshold.description: A positive percentage value. If present, indicates the data shall only be logged if the modulus of the percentage change in the logged attribute value with respect to the previous sample is greater than the onChangeThreshold.

allOf.description: In this mode attributes are logged using a time based profile. A single logger can have multiple sampling profiles for a single set of attributes. Each sampling profile defines one or more instants in time when a sample of all these attributes should be logged.

content.description: Functions to log. If a logical device logged does not support one of the listed functions, the data is just not logged. Only the specified supported functions are logged. This allows a single data log to be used for devices with a different set of functions.

attributeScope.description: If set, only those attributes specified by function (functionId, functionType and attributes) that matches the specified scope will be logged. (i.e: attributeScope='measurement' and function.functionType='LampActuatorFunction' means all the measurement attributes of all the Lamp Actuator functions of the logged devices will be recorded). If it is not set, all attributes specified by the function attributes will be logged.

function.description: Either a functionId or functionType shall be included. If a functionType is used, the description shall apply to all functions of that type

attributes.description: One or more attributes of the function to log.

name.description: Name of the attribute to be logged.

onChangeThreshold.description: A positive percentage value. If present, indicates the data shall only be logged if the modulus of the percentage change in the logged attribute value with respect to the previous sample is greater than the onChangeThreshold.

samplingProfiles.description: Each sampling profile defines one or more instants in time when a sample of all these attributes should be logged.

samplingStartTime.description: Time instant to start the sampling process. As defined by OAS3, all options of date-time - RFC3339 shall be supported.

samplingPeriod.description: Time between consecutive samples. If samplingPeriod is not specified, a single sample shall be taken at the specified samplingStartTime or immediately if samplingStartTime has already past so long as samplingEndTime has not yet past.

samplingEndTime.description: Time to stop sampling. It shall have the same time format as the samplingStartTime. It shall be supported if periodic sampling is supported. As defined by OAS3, all options of date-time - RFC3339 shall be supported.

allOf.description: In this mode the data logger records events which occur within the ODN. The TALQ defined events can be generic, service specific or function specific. The set of events to be recorded is specified by the sourceEvents whitelist or blacklist attributes.

sourceEvents.description: This attribute specifies the set of applicable events defined by the white list reduced by the set defined by the black list. If there is only a black list defined, even if empty, all events shall be recorded except listed in the black list. If there is no white list, nor a black list, no event shall be recorded. For a better understanding, these are the possible combinations and their consequence: sourceEvents={wl:[], bl:[]} => No events to log (white empty list of events, reduced by empty blackList of events, so no events); sourceEvents={bl:[]} => All events to log (as per spec: If there is only a black list defined, even if empty, all events shall be recorded except listed in the black list.); sourceEvents={wl:[]} => No events to log (white empty list of events, so no events); sourceEvents={} = No events to log (as per spec: If there is no white list, nor a black list, event shall be recorded.).

whiteList.description: Content is recorded upon the occurrence of the specified events.

blackList.description: Content shall not be recorded for the specified events in the blacklist.

numberOfRetries.description: Maximum number of retries for reporting data collected by a data logger. Default value shall be 3.

allOf.description: In the scheduled mode, a list of reporting times defines when the data, if any, shall be transferred to the CMS. A randomization factor shall be applied if the randomTime parameter is specified.

times.description: Sequence of specified times within a day to report. If no timezone designator (Z or +/- offset), the time shall follow DST.

randomTime.description: Amount of time (in seconds) used to randomize the reporting of the data log at the specific reporting times. If specified, before each report is transmitted, the data log shall be reported at the specific report interval plus a random number chosen between 0 and the RandomTime parameter.

allOf.description: In the immediate reporting mode, a logReport message shall be sent as soon as there is a change recorded in the data log. To prevent sending multiple small messages when several entries are recorded at almost the same time, a delay parameter can be specified. The delay starts as soon as the data log is modified and shall not be prolonged due to changes during the delay period. The logReport message sent after the delay shall also contain the changes recorded during the delay period.

delay.description: If delay is 0, report when the log changes. For all other values, wait delay (in seconds) when the log changes before reporting.  The reported log shall include all updates that happened during the delay period.

LogReport.description: This is a message sent by the Gateway to the CMS to transfer data recorded by a logger. The report contains the address of the logger and zero or some entries.

cmsRefId.description: The cmsRefId is a free text to be used by the CMS for any purpose, e.g: to differentiate contexts. It is a token that allows the CMS to match client requests to the original notification.

data.description: It can be AttributeLogData, EventLogData or StateChangeEventLogData.

srcAddress.description: TALQ Address of device or function within a device which is the source of the attribute or event (or to which this event applies), it can be {deviceAddress} or {deviceAddress}/{functionId}. If unknown, the srcAddress shall point at the Gateway. The address

timestamp.description: Instant when the logData is created. As defined by OAS3, all options of date-time - RFC3339 shall be supported

allOf.description: Attribute log data contains a single attribute, with name and value, in each single log entry.

Event log data contains a single event, with eventType and value, in each single log entry. It also includes information about whether the log denotes the start or end of the event. Furthermore additional information can be added with the info attribute.

startEndFlag.description: To report the start (true) and end (false) of a period where the condition reported yields. If not included, the event reported is not denoting a period (like 'controller rebooted')

info.description: An additional description for the event. The ODN can be configured to use descriptions in one or more languages, but to configure it is outside the scope of the specification. String can refer to attributes from the set below using either {<ordinal>} or {<tag>}. The <ordinal> refers to the nth sub element of the attributes array. The <tag> is used to lookup the attribute based on the tag. When using the latter form, the description string can be made part of the event definitions.

attributes.description: A sequence of attributes logged together with the event.

allOf.description: Value of the attribute.

srcAddress.description: Address of the source of the data.

allOf.description: The command which triggered the change event.
If the state is not equal to the command, it may be logged as well.

DataPackage.description: Describes a vendor-specific package of data which may be transferred transparently from the CMS to the Gateway using the Data Package Transfer Service. Content of the package is out of scope of this specification.

ownerCMS.description: The address of the owner CMS

downloadUri.description: The uri of binary data to download

EventType.description: The TALQ Application Protocol defines TALQ Events that can be reported from the ODNs to the CMS in order to facilitate system management and diagnosis. Events provide information about a certain situation or condition that are useful when managing the ODNs. There are event types that are mandatory depending on the profile. Despite the status attributes (those with 'x-talq-scope': 'event') implementation is optional, the event type mandatoriness for each profile can be found at the definition of the status attribute with the same name (i.e: deviceReset event type and BasicFunction.deviceReset attribute). [DEPRECATED: the controlGearComFailure is deprecated and it will be removed at the next MAJOR version, use controlGearCommFailure instead].

fGenericEvents.description: Events not related to a specific function or service.

fGatewayEvents.description: Events related to the Gateway function.

ResourceReference.description: Describes the reference to a given entity (device, group, calendar, etc.) by its resource and address parts, ex: /devices/{deviceAddress} => resource:'devices',address:'{deviceAddress}'

resource.description: The resource identifier. This property informs the destination endpoint about the entity type, ex: groups, devices.

address.description: Address of the entity, device, group, calendar, etc. When using device addresses, it can be referred to a specific function or attribute by adding its id or name, ex for device: {deviceAddress}/{functionId} or {deviceAddress}/{functionId}/{attributeName}
